lead_paragraph: MAZOR--Fred Donald. Died peacefully at St. John's Riverside Hospital in Yonkers, NY, on Sunday, March 6, 2016, after a long illness. He was a son of Frieda and Charles Mazor and is survived by his nephew, Mark Mazor and niece, Stacey Roantree, both of Atlanta, Georgia. Fred was born in Brooklyn, NY, on March 17, 1938. He earned a BA from Baruch School of CCNY in 1959, an MSW (Masters in Social Work) from Smith College School for Social Work and a DSW (Doctorate in Social Work) from Columbia School of Social Work. He had a long career as a clinical social worker in private practice in New York City. In the aftermath of 9/11, he volunteered for the Red Cross providing pro bono counseling for families who lost loved ones. He later traveled to New Orleans to assist families who were stricken by Hurricane Katrina. He continued with the Red Cross as a Disaster Mental Health Volunteer with leadership responsibilities until the end of his life. For many years he was a member of the New York State Society for Clinical Social Work and was past president of their Metropolitan New York Chapter as well as president of his co-op for ten years. He will be remembered by his family and the many friends who loved him for his warmth and caring and for his great sense of humor. Contributions may be made to the American Red Cross of Greater New York. Friends of Fred Mazor 1/3
